intro: Cheiranthus armeniacus, commonly known as Armenian candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly areas. The flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
